file_content.text: Who authorized you to be here?
Find those terrorists who destroyed the Dominator. Find them and hurt them for me.
Glad to see you well, my friend.
You're the new alien, huh? We'll see how that works out.
I'm Fixer Twelve. Used to be a field operative, but these days I keep this place running.
You're the new blood? Huh. We'll see if you work out.
I used to be a field operative, same as you. Now I'm a Fixer. I keep this place running.
You must be an old hand at this. Any wisdom to share?
Got any advice?
You want advice? Heh. Stay away from politics.
Why'd you stop working in the field?
You were an operative?
Wasn't by choice. I was a good agent until a Jedi shoved a lightsaber through my lungs. That's service. That's sacrifice.
Not the most glamorous work, but someone needs to do it.
I suppose that's useful.
We all find ways of serving the Empire. Of course, not everyone understands what service is really about.
People here'll tell you that the Sith interfere with our work, Keeper's always fighting with the Minister of Intelligence--that sort of thing.
Maybe they're right--but it doesn't matter. Our job's to obey orders. Our job's to deal with the enemy.
And who do you consider to be our enemy?
The enemy?
Agreed.
Then you can consider me a friend. Imperial Intelligence needs more agents like you.
I need to get back to duty, but remember our talk. You have potential.
It sounds like a hard-line position.
Isn't that extreme?
Then I'm a hard-liner.
The Empire has a lot of enemies, the Republic and the Jedi first up. We should focus on getting them, not fighting one another.
Remember that, and maybe you'll last longer than most new agents.
I'll try to keep it all in mind.
Got it.
Good choice. Be careful out there.
It's been good talking to you, Fixer.
I should get going.
Yeah--you, too.
You're awfully arrogant for a glorified mechanic.
You think you know a lot, huh?
I've got experience. More than you've got.
